name: Street Fighter® IV
description: Street Fighter® IV brings the legendary fighting series back to its roots by taking the beloved fighting moves and techniques of the original Street Fighter® II, and infusing them with Capcom's latest advancements in next generation technology.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista                     Processor: Intel Pentium 4 2.0 GHz and up                      Memory: 1 GB RAM                     Graphics: DirectX 9.0c/Shader3.0 and up supported (operation on-board is not guaranteed)      Video: NVIDIA GeForce 6600 and up (except for NVIDIA GeForce 7300), VRAM: 256MB and up (operation sharing with main memory is not guaranteed)                      Hard Drive: 4.5 GB free hard drive space                     Sound: DirectSound, DirectX9.0c Compatible Audio Other Requirements: Online play requires software installation of and log-in to Games For Windows - LIVE
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows Vista                     Processor: Intel Core2 Duo 2.0 GHz and up                      Memory: 2 GB RAM                     Graphics: DirectX 9.0c/Shader3.0 and up supported (operation on-board is not guaranteed)      Video: NVIDIA GeForce 8600 and up, VRAM: 512MB and up (operation sharing with main memory is not guaranteed)                      Hard Drive: 4.5 GB free hard drive space                     Sound: DirectSound, DirectX9.0c Compatible Audio

reviews.review_text: Great Game! But You guys should buy instead SF4 Arcade edition
this is not upgradeable and uses windows live gaming environment. Spend an extra 10.00 to get ultra SF4, well worth it.

One of the best fighting games since a long time. The graphics are beautiful, just beau-ti-ful and the fighting is fluid. I HATE the pop song that plays in the main menu and I HATE Seth. That cheap ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. I've only been able to defeat him using Zangief so far. With my amazing, god-like skills mind you. One thing I hate as well is, in case of Zangief, that I never seem to be able to pull off his Ultra combo. He ALWAYS performs his Super. What's up with that ? Like I can't press the same button 3 times in a row really fast. No, I'm not physically challenged. Dear SFIV, I spit on you ! ... ... No, I didn't mean that ! Come back, please ! Fine, fine, I'll be playing Super Street Fighter IV then. Let's see how that works out...  [Rating: 80/100]
Beautiful artwork... this is all that I need to write.

This game has to be seen in motion to believe the level of fluidity it has. It is said to be more accessible to casual gamers than previoous versions of Street Fighter, and I agree. However, I wouldn't venture onine with this until you have a strong understanding of core game mechanics. Game controller or joysticks are all but required to play - computer keyboard will do you no justice. Great game to have around for the 10 minute game session or when you have friends over.

I was kinda looking forward to this game and eventualy was disappointed. The controls are not that great and even the gameplay and difficulty are needed to be set on very easy just to enjoy the game. If you want a SF title just buy the Arcade or Ultra edition.
